creator: Adam, Graeme Mercer, 1839-1912. (author)
description: Adam, Graeme Mercer: 1839-1912. Born and educated in Scotland; Toronto editor, publisher, and author (Wallace, Dictionary of Canadian biography). // At head of title: "From savagery to civilisation." Cover title: "The Northwest: Its history and its troubles." Also published, Whitby, Ont.: J.S. Robertson, 1885 (viii, 390p.); 2nd edition, Toronto: Rose Publishing Co. & Whitby, Ont.: J.S. Robertson, 1885 (viii, [9]-408p.). The 2nd edition, published after the Regina trials, contains an appendix describing the court proceedings.
subject: History--General

title: The Canadian North-West: Its history and its troubles, from the early days of the fur trade to the era of the railway and the settler: With incidents of travel in the region, and the narrative of three insurrections
